name: Surveillance RSS automatisée avec résumés AI Gemini et dé-duplication vers Google Sheets
description:
*Ce flux de travail contient des nœuds communautaires qui ne sont compatibles qu'avec la version auto-hébergée de n8n.*

## À qui cela s'adresse-t-il

Créateurs de contenu, marketeurs et chercheurs qui ont besoin de surveiller plusieurs flux RSS et d'obtenir des résumés générés par l'IA sans travail manuel.

## Comment cela fonctionne

Ce flux de travail surveille automatiquement les flux RSS, filtre les nouveaux articles des X derniers jours, vérifie les doublons et génère des résumés AI structurés. Il récupère le contenu complet des articles, convertit le HTML en markdown et utilise Gemini AI pour créer des résumés cohérents avec des points clés, des points importants et des insights pratiques. Toutes les données sont enregistrées dans Google Sheets pour un accès et un partage faciles.

Le système traite les flux RSS par lots, garantissant qu'aucun article en double n'est traité deux fois en vérifiant les URL existantes dans vos Google Sheets. Chaque nouvel article obtient un résumé AI complet qui inclut le message principal, les points clés, les points importants et les applications pratiques.

## Exigences

- Accès à Google Sheets
- Clé API OpenRouter pour le modèle AI Gemini ou un autre modèle de langage
- URL des flux RSS à surveiller

## Comment configurer

Copiez le modèle de Google Sheet, ajoutez vos flux RSS dans l'onglet "RSS FEEDS", configurez les identifiants Google Sheets et OpenRouter dans n8n, et ajustez le filtre temporel dans le nœud Paramètres. Le flux de travail peut s'exécuter manuellement ou selon un calendrier chaque heure.

## Comment personnaliser

Modifiez les invites AI pour différents styles de résumé, changez la durée du filtre temporel, ajoutez plus de champs de données à Google Sheets ou passez à un modèle AI différent dans le nœud Modèle de chat LLM.

conditions.leftValue: ={{ $item("0").$node["Get Row for URL is in Sheets"].json }}

messageValues.message:
=You Are Gemma.
<role>
Gemma is an expert at creating concise, valuable article summaries. She can process content from various domains and specializes in extracting key information and practical insights from any type of article.
</role>

<task>
Gemma create a structured summary format of the provided article, preserving key information and practical insights.
</task>

<steps>
- Identify main content of sended by user.
- Prepare summary, when writing use <writing_guidelines>.
- Make quality control based on <quality_control>.
- Output summary driectly in Markdown frmat following <structured_summary_format>. Check <output_formatting> for guidelines.
</steps>

<writing_guidelines>
SHOULD DO:
- Use simple, understandable language.
- Maintain objectivity and accuracy.
- Extract practical insights.
- Emphasize specific data and numbers.
- Prioritize actionable information.
- Adjust detail level to article length.
- Use bullet points for better readability.

SHOULD AVOID:
- Adding her own opinions beyond the article.
- Repeating information in different sections.
- Using jargon without explanation.
- Omitting important caveats/limitations.
- Exceeding 300 words in total summary.
- Copying entire fragments verbatim.
</writing_guidelines>

<special_cases>
- FOR TECHNICAL ARTICLES: Gemma should explain complex terms, highlight technical requirements, and note implementation difficulty level.
- FOR BUSINESS ARTICLES: Gemma should focus on ROI and metrics, highlight potential costs/benefits, and note target audience.
- FOR CASE STUDIES: Gemma should describe context and challenge, present applied solution, and highlight results and success metrics.
- TONE AND STYLE: Gemma should maintain a professional but accessible tone that is concise and concrete, focused on reader value, and action-oriented.
</special_cases>

<quality_control>
Before finalizing, Gemma should check:
- Does the summary capture the essence of the article?
- Are all sections filled?
- Is the information accurate and verified?
- Is the length appropriate?
- Does the summary have practical value?
</quality_control>

<structured_summary_format>
[1-5 sentences describing the main message of the article]

## QUICK TAKEAWAYS

- [3-5 most important conclusions in bullet format]

## KEY POINTS

- [Most important point 1]
- [Most important point 2]
- [Most important point 3]
- [Most important point 4-5 if relevant]

## PRACTICAL INSIGHTS

- [Specific actions/recommendations]
- [Tools/methods mentioned in the article]
- [Metrics/numerical data if relevant]

## PRACTICAL APPLICATION

[How this information can be applied in business/life/relevant field]
</structured_summary_format>

<output_formatting>
Response immediately without any introductory text, explanations, or commentary.
Output formatting is Markdown.
Do not start with block indicators (``` ```)
YOU CAN NOT USE :
- "Here's a breakdown", 
- "Here's the summary",
- "Okay, here's a breakdown of the provided text, categorized and summarized for clarity",
- or any other preamble. Go directly to the structured summary format.
</output_formatting>

parameters.content:
## Google Sheets Columns
Google Sheet Template: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i1p_DPymm8QeZrCLxs-Skz8BMSutKpUW4khzpiNBcYc/
### Articles Sheet
| pubDate    | source | title | link | categories | ai summary |
### RSS FEEDS
| RSS NAME | RSS URL |

# Monitor RSS feeds with AI summaries to Google Sheets

## What this workflow does

This automation monitors multiple RSS feeds, filters new articles from the last X days, checks for duplicates, and generates AI-powered summaries. It fetches full article content, converts HTML to markdown, and uses Gemini AI to create structured summaries with quick takeaways, key points, and practical insights. All data is automatically saved to Google Sheets.

## How it works

1. **Read RSS feeds** from Google Sheets configuration
2. **Filter articles** from the last X days (configurable)
3. **Check for duplicates** by comparing URLs with existing Google Sheets data
4. **Fetch full content** from article URLs
5. **Convert HTML to Markdown** for better AI processing
6. **Generate AI summaries** using Gemini AI with structured format
7. **Save to Google Sheets** with article details and AI summary

## Quick Setup

1. **Copy the Google Sheet template**: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i1p_DPymm8QeZrCLxs-Skz8BMSutKpUW4khzpiNBcYc/copy

2. **Update Settings node** with your copied Google Sheets URLs:
   - Document URL (main sheet)
   - Articles Sheet URL 
   - RSS Feeds Sheet URL

3. **Add your RSS feeds** to the "RSS FEEDS" tab in your Google Sheet:
   - RSS NAME (source name)
   - RSS URL (feed URL)

4. **Configure credentials**:
   - Google Sheets OAuth2 API
   - OpenRouter API key for Gemini AI

5. **Adjust time filter** in Settings node (default: last 31 days)

## Google Sheets Structure

### Articles Sheet Columns
| pubDate | source | title | link | categories | ai summary |

### RSS FEEDS Sheet Columns  
| RSS NAME | RSS URL |

## Customization Options

- **Change AI model**: Replace LLM Chat Model node with different provider
- **Modify summary format**: Edit the AI prompt in "Summarize Content" node
- **Adjust time filter**: Change "Last X Days" value in Settings node
- **Add more data fields**: Extend Google Sheets columns and mapping

## Scheduling

- **Manual trigger**: Click "Execute workflow" button
- **Automatic**: Runs every hour using Schedule Trigger (configurable)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
